dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: HA HA HA! No, you are not serious. Well, um, Boeing is, like, officially asking for, what, $60 billion in aid? From the government. A bailout? After all the 737 MAX fiascos? Seriously? They want our money after that whole mess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: H A H A H A! No, you are not serious. Well, um, Boeing is, like, officially asking for, what, sixty dollars billion in aid? From the government. A bailout? After all the seven hundred thirty seven M A X fiascos? Seriously? They want our money after that whole mess?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The statement didnt specify how much of the $60 billion the company believes it needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, they're stressing it's for the broader U.S. aerospace industry, you know? Keeping, uh, suppliers afloat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, they're stressing it's for the broader U.S. aerospace industry, you know? Keeping, uh, suppliers afloat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Boeing stressed in a statement that financial support for the company would flow through to its suppliers and support the broader health of the U.S. aerospace industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, please. The industry? These guys were privately discussing government loans back in December, way before the full pandemic hit. But, you know, the cash burn from undelivered MAX planes, then the coronavirus... their stock plummeted 44%. It's a crisis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, please. The industry? These guys were privately discussing government loans back in December, way before the full pandemic hit. But, you know, the cash burn from undelivered M A X planes, then the coronavirus... their stock plummeted forty four percent. It's a crisis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Concern has been rising over the past week that Boeing may face a liquidity crisis, with its stock plummeting 44% over that span to close Tuesday at $124.14, its lowest point since 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A crisis they helped create. Let's not forget the billions in share buybacks over the past decade. Enriching executives, not building a buffer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A crisis they helped create. Let's not forget the billions in share buybacks over the past decade. Enriching executives, not building a buffer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Critics of the prospect of so much taxpayer money going to Boeing and the airlines have focused on the billions of dollars worth of share buybacks that they have made over the past decade, enriching executives and their shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but, um, analysts are saying they face a serious liquidity crunch. And Trump even said he wants to, quote, "protect Boeing."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but, um, analysts are saying they face a serious liquidity crunch. And Trump even said he wants to, quote, protect Boeing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Concern has been rising over the past week that Boeing may face a liquidity crisis... Earlier in the day, President Trump said at a press conference that support would be forthcoming. I think we have to protect Boeing, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Protect them? It's like, "Oops, we made unsafe planes, burned cash, and now we need taxpayer money because we didn't save any!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Protect them? It's like, Oops, we made unsafe planes, burned cash, and now we need taxpayer money because we didn't save any!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: There will be conditions though. Congressional sources are saying things like suspending dividends, protecting workers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: There will be conditions though. Congressional sources are saying things like suspending dividends, protecting workers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, lawmakers and labor groups will seek to put conditions on the assistance. Suspension of Boeings continued dividends to its shareholders could be one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: 'Conditions.' Yeah, we heard that song and dance with the banks in '08. How much do you want to bet shareholders still walk away fine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: 'Conditions.' Yeah, we heard that song and dance with the banks in 'eight. How much do you want to bet shareholders still walk away fine?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Sara Nelson from the Flight Attendants union is pretty vocal, though. No bonuses, no buybacks, she wants payroll commitments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sara Nelson from the Flight Attendants union is pretty vocal, though. No bonuses, no buybacks, she wants payroll commitments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sara Nelson, the president of the Association of Flight Attendants-CWA, vowed Monday that airlines wouldnt make out as easy as the banks did in 2008... Airlines must commit to maintaining payroll. It means no bonuses, no buybacks, & no breaking union contracts in bankruptcy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Vocal, sure. But we're talking about a company that already drew $13.8 billion from a line of credit last month. They'll find a way around it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Vocal, sure. But we're talking about a company that already drew thirteen point eight dollars billion from a line of credit last month. They'll find a way around it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Chicago-based company disclosed in an SEC filing after the close of trading that it had fully drawn $13.8 billion from a line of credit it had arranged just last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So you're saying it's, uh, basically a guaranteed repeat? No real change?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So you're saying it's, uh, basically a guaranteed repeat? No real change?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: I'm saying I'll believe it when I see it. All this sounds like more of the same to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I'm saying I'll believe it when I see it. All this sounds like more of the same to me.
